text: A variety of therapeutics have been developed to mimic sugars that bind at the relatively deep sugar binding site of NA (compared to HA) to combat influenza virus infection. These NA-inhibitors are most commonly N-Acetylneuraminic acid (Neu5Ac) derivatives, which competitively inhibit NA activity [104] . Additionally structure-based development of competitive inhibitors against the glycan binding sites of HN glycoproteins have been explored [102, 105] .
